contextId.information: Life is compared to a shadow that passes quickly. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: numbered days through which he passes like a shadow

contextId.information: Just as no one has the ability to stop himself from breathing, no one can continue living when it is time to die. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: No one is ruler over his breath so as to stop the breath ... no one has power over the day of his death

contextId.information: Possible meanings are 1) the writer compares the length of the wicked person's life to a shadow that passes quickly or 2) the quality or enjoyment of life is fleeting to a wicked person, there is no substance to his life. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: His days are like a fleeting shadow

contextId.information: Just as flies can ruin perfume, so folly can ruin a person's reputation for wisdom and honor. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: As dead flies ... so a little folly
